714951f-b.title: Manhattan: 102nd Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
714951f-b.text:
(1)
E. 1O2nd Street, est from a roint betveen Lexington and ark Avenues and across the latter to Central Parlc (seen in the distance ). The stone arched viaduct shown carries the road-bed of the New York Central Railroad above the street levei. Buildings in the foreground are tenerents and are within the shadow of Fifth Avenue apartmments that fringe the park. Note to the right the vacant area caused by the demolition of structures not conforming to present building and sanitary requirements; slum clearance.
September 14, 1938.
P.L. Sperr
(2)
Building shown on the right of view No. 1, located at and adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Park Avenue, as viewed northuard from the aforementioned clearance.
September 14, 1938.
P. L. Sperr

714950f-a.title: Manhattan: 102nd Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
714950f-a.text:
E. 1O2nd Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Lexington Avenue (foreground) as viewed northeastward across a vacant lot at the S.E. corner. Buildings to the left are on the east side of the Avenue and which makes a sharp drop downhill. Note the absence of the former surface car tracks and the presence of the sign at the left indicating a changed form
of transportation.
September 14, 1938.
P.L. Sperr

721099f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 102nd Street
721099f-a.text:
North on Mexington Avenue from N. W. corner of 1O2nd Street.
June 26, 1931.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
